article_title: Protesters call out congressman on climate change
article_text:
Protesters call out congressman on climate change

Photo: Brendan Gibbons /San Antonio Express-News Protestors gather outside the San Antonio office of U.S. Rep. Lamar...

Protesters gathered outside U.S. Rep. Lamar Smith’s San Antonio office Tuesday to award him for his “tireless work rejecting well-established and obvious scientific fact.”

article_metadata.description: About 40 environmental activists gave Smith a tongue-in-cheek “Flat Earth” award for rejecting scientific evidence that supports human-caused global warming.  The protest drew activists with the Texas Drought Project, Texas Campaign for the Environment, the Alamo Chapter of the Sierra Club, Energia Mia, San Antonio Environmental Democrats and others.  “He’s dangerous,” Locke said, arguing that Smith’s efforts to discredit mainstream climate science stem from his support from fossil-fuel industries, the top sector that gave to Smith in 2014 — $62,200 to his campaign committee and political action committee, according to records.
article_metadata.author.name: By Brendan Gibbons, Staff Writer
